page.title: 14M6 LINK, CREWE
page.content: A road link to the M6 motorway from Crewe, first planned in 1959, is to be built 4-7 miles in length from the roundabout near Crewe station to junction 16 of the motorway. It will cost approximately Â£10 million. Of three proposed routes the most northerly has been chosen. 68 acres of prime farming land will be used. No buildings need to be demolished. Work will begin in September 1985 and will take 18 months to complete. The journey from Crewe to the motorway will take 5 minutes instead of the present 20 minutes. It will take heavy traffic away from villages and off minor roads. At the same time link to the M6 is to be provides from the Royal Ordnance Factory at Radway Green.
